events.text:
DATE: MARCH 1937
LOCATION: ROAD TO KOLKATA

events.question: After leaving the clinic, you notice Mateo trying to limp by himself.
After leaving the clinic, you notice Mateo trying to limp by himself.

events.text: Hey Mateo, let me support you.
You move to support his arms.
Oi–I can take care of myself!
He smiles at you easily and tries to hop away.
Hey, hey, [i]no[/i]. Let me help you.
No need, [YOUR NAME]! I can take care of myself just fine, hehe.

events.question: Mateo, you [i]just[/i] got patched up. Please. I want to help you.

events.choice: Wrap your arm around his shoulder.

events.text: You hear Mateo breathe a quiet sigh of relief.
See? Isn’t that better?
Mateo smiles at you and scoots closer.
Yeah, but…
He shifts awkwardly.
I can take care of myself.
You continue slowly walking together down the path. A little ways ahead, Raj and the Professor are engrossed in a passionate discussion about Sandy and the physics of magic.

events.question: Why was Mateo so resistant to accepting help?

events.text: Mateo hesitates, before pasting a smile on his face.
Because I can! Why, I wouldn’t have been able to survive in Hawaii all by myself if I [i]wasn’t[/i] able to take care of myself, would I? I’m a capable person!
Despite his cheer, you can hear a hint of strain. You can tell he’s… forcing himself to be optimistic.
Mateo whistles a little tune and smiles pleasantly at you. You’ve noticed he smiles a lot.
He’s starting to lean against you now–a good sign.

You know, I never thought I’d ever lean on someone else like this, haha. Even back home, I was the one who reached out a helping hand to my parents and siblings, always darting around and helping out. I made lots of friends [i]because[/i] I was so helpful.
He forces himself to smile again.
I’ve always been the strong one. The one who could protect others and make sacrifices for them. You know, I was so surprised when you interfered back in Hawaii, when I was about to sell my guitar…

Mateo laughs warmly, and you see his cheeks are tinged with a rosy color.
You feel your cheeks warm, too. It’s always a pleasure to hear Mateo laugh.
Mateo holds your hand and squeezes it.

events.question: Why did you do it? You barely knew me! And even now, when I’m [i]perfectly[/i] fine, you insist I lean on you!

events.text: Mateo’s blush deepens.
You…
Mateo shakes his head.
But I’m more trouble than helpful…

You, trouble? You’re not trouble at all, Mateo. You helped us when we were in a pickle in Hawaii. When we were fleeing from the soldiers in Tokyo… you saved us. Don’t cut your accomplishments short, Mateo.
Tears prick the corners of Mateo’s eyes.
Thank you, [YOUR NAME].
Mateo laughs.
You definitely are! There’s a lot I admire about you.
Your blush deepens.

I mean it. I’m grateful to even [i]know[/i] you. You’re so brave and strong and skilled, I… I can’t even compare. I’m just a failed musician, someone who had a dream and gave it up.
While you, you have dreams and ambitions you’re still actively striving for. I admire that–I admire [i]you[/i]–a lot.

You smile and squeeze Mateo’s hand.
He rests his head against your shoulder.
I’m always happy to help…
Mateo flushes even more.
[i]Me?[/i] But–what’s there to even [i]like[/i] about me?!
You step closer to him and snuggle into his side.

Lots, Mateo. You’re charming. You’re kind. You’re passionate. You’re selfless–and that is what worries me. It’s a virtue, yes, but… selflessness to self-detriment… isn’t.
I don’t want you to get hurt. I care about you, Mateo, and I want to help you when you’re in need, like this.

You squeeze his shoulders.
Tears prick Mateo’s eyes.
Mateo smiles and snuggles closer into your side. His voice is barely a whisper when he speaks again:
Thank you, [YOUR NAME].
